column4: Okay, I have just decided it is impossible to boot from a USB cdrom if the computer was made before 2001
it is difficult to boot from most USB devices for a computer that old.
when does it freeze when you boot with the feisty kernel?
I mean does it display the Ubuntu logo and just sit there, or does it give an error message or just a blank screen?
can't access tty: job control turned off ?
please write down whatever it says when it fails to load (at least the last few lines)
select that kernel, hit e to edit it.  delete quiet and splash, hit enter to accept the change, enter again to boot

okay, that maybe can be fixed.  You should edit fstab to replace UUID=... to point to your drives as /dev/sd?? instead of UUID, or fix the UUID.  I've read that a lot of people have problems with some disk controllers when upgrading to feisty.  You might also just stick with edgy unless you have a special need to upgrade.
UUID is a way of identifying devices and filesystems uniquely.  So if you move your hardware around it will still know which is which.
you can try loading your drives by /dev/ instead of UUID or switch to a different kernel
yeah, you can just use the older kernel (go with Edgy's if that works)
you'd have to do that by editing /etc/fstab  ... and I'm not sure it will work.
root=/dev/sda1 (or whatever is correct for your computer)
do you have ide or sata hard drives?
probably ide (which is good because it is less likely to change drive numbers with different operating systems).
